item.description:
Craig Burton, a Utah tech visionary from the 80s, has died. https://t.co/lpYtWsW5LP

I hope people can reach the Facebook page.

It's all there is right now.

I look to @dsearls to create a public memorial on the web. That's how I met Craig, through Doc.

Craig was a very wise man.
item.source:markdown:
Craig Burton, a Utah tech visionary from the 80s, has died. https://t.co/lpYtWsW5LP
I hope people can reach the Facebook page.
It's all there is right now.
I look to @dsearls to create a public memorial on the web. That's how I met Craig, through Doc.
Craig was a very wise man.

item.description: Thanks to the @twitterdev people for helping out with a problem with one of my domains. I have to say the new style of developer relations at Twitter, whoever is responsible for it, is really refreshing. ;-)

item.title: The default place-of-record for writers
item.description:
I would love to see a university-based open source project to create a Medium-like service, run as a non-profit, written and maintained by students, with the help of teachers of course, funded by foundations and contributors.

The mistake we keep making is relying VCs to create a simple default place-of-record for writing on the internet. Medium has a great user interface, but because they had to find an elusive business model, it kept changing what it was.

I honestly don't think it's possible to create a default place-of-record for writing with a business model attached.

The university that took this project on would have a long-term source of project funding, and their students would learn more than computer science, they'd learn how to create and support a real world system that means something.

And if I recall correctly college students are often searching for that kind of experience, to do meaningful work with their talents.
item.source:markdown:
I would love to see a university-based open source project to create a Medium-like service, run as a non-profit, written and maintained by students, with the help of teachers of course, funded by foundations and contributors.
The mistake we keep making is relying VCs to create a simple default place-of-record for writing on the internet. Medium has a great user interface, but because they had to find an elusive business model, it kept changing what it was.
I honestly don't think it's possible to create a default place-of-record for writing with a business model attached.
The university that took this project on would have a long-term source of project funding, and their students would learn more than computer science, they'd learn how to create and support a real world system that means something.
And if I recall correctly college students are often searching for that kind of experience, to do meaningful work with their talents.

item.description:
@johnrobb thanks john -- i'd say it's been stagnant not frozen.

no reason it couldn't move, it's just that people didn't know how to do it or want to do the work needed.

i do think you'll like where it's going. ;-)
